channel.title: NPC's don't appear?
channel.description:
Thank you for checking out this post.
I downloaded a blank source and client from this website; at http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?topic=407757.0
So I started coding into and such (I'm new to Java).
I put into the Autospawn.cfg "// NpcID CoordX CoordY Height RangeX1 RangeY1 RangeX2 RangeY2 WalkType Descrption
Spawn = 1 3222 3218 0 0 0 0 0 0 Man Train"
The NPC didn't show up in the server. (Yes, I compiled and tried changing all the values multiple times in different combinations...). Those coordinates are, of course, in Lumbridge.
Compile also didn't show any errors.
The attached images relay that information, and as you can tell from the other spawns other than the first one listed, I tried a different location. I toyed with heights, ranges, walk type. Anything I could think of.
Last thing I can think of is, MAYBE, the server isn't calling the models, or the client?
Thank you for reading. Any help is greatly appreciated.

item.title: NPC's don't appear?
item.dc:creator: @5starsnypee5 5starsnypee5
item.description:
@5starsnypee5 wrote:

Not sure if it’s a delta, but I’ll try. Thank you for the response. Going to check it right nao.

Didn’t work. Though thank you much for the suggestion. c:

Searched through npchandler, didn’t see anything right off. Client doesn’t have anything called npchandler.java, only npchandler.npc, though I’m sure that’s how it’s supposed to be.

Supposedly according to the forum I got this in, it’s a blank Allstar.

Sorry for all the noobiness. Maybe I should try to code an RSPS in C#…

Read full topic

item.title: NPC's don't appear?
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

if its delta remove this part

Spawn = 1 3222 3218 0 0 0 0 0 0 Man Train"
<<<<<< /man train removed)
make it look like
Spawn = 1 3222 3218 0 0 0 0 0 0

item.title: NPC's don't appear?
item.dc:creator: @Level_120_Dungeoneer Level 120 Dungeoneering
item.description:
@Level_120_Dungeoneer wrote:

[quote=“Level 120 Dungeoneering, post:6, topic:435914”][quote author=5starsnypee5 link=topic=538630.msg3941382#msg3941382 date=1331432300]
Already had that, but copied and pasted in case the code was entered wrong. Still doesn’t work. Going to try a different client.

Different client still didn’t work. Has to be server sided. Does anything else have to do with the autospawn.cfg? Like maybe the client.java isn’t calling any of the npc listings in the first place?
[/quote]

Well of course it’s server sided. You don’t handle NPC through the client. Check in NPCHandler in your server for the code I mentioned.[/quote]

Read full topic
